A polypeptide is polymer of amino acids held together by peptide bonds. The process of dehydration synthesis creates these peptide bonds, as shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Amino acids are linked through the formation of peptide bonds.

As shown in Figure 1, an amino acid must have which of the following properties in order to be incorporated into a polypeptide?

choices.label: The ability to remain stable in the presence of water molecules

An <math alttext="R group" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>R-group</mtext></mrow></math> that is compatible with the <math alttext="R group" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>R-group</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> of the last amino acid incorporated
A central carbon atom that reacts with a nitrogen atom to form the peptide bond

The ability to form a covalent bond with both its <math alttext="N H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> group and its <math alttext="C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>COOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group

content.answer: The ability to form a covalent bond with both its <math alttext="N H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> group and its <math alttext="C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>COOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group
